title: Dove Real Beauty Campaign
summary: Dove's 'Real Beauty' campaign challenged conventional beauty standards and used PR storytelling to build deep emotional connections with consumers, transforming a commodity soap brand into a purpose-driven movement.
background: In 2004, Dove was a mid-range soap brand struggling to differentiate in a crowded market. Research found that only 2% of women considered themselves beautiful.
response: Dove launched a campaign featuring real women of diverse ages, sizes, and ethnicities. The PR strategy combined advertising, earned media, social sharing, and grassroots advocacy to amplify the message.
outcome: Sales increased from $2.5 billion to $4 billion in the campaign's first three years. The campaign won multiple Cannes Lions and is credited with pioneering purpose-driven brand communications.
lessons: PR and advertising work best when integrated
discussion_questions: Why did the Real Beauty concept resonate globally?
What risks did Dove take and how were they managed?
